poem:
### Accelerating Costs

Instructors' cars line up like dominoes,  
the cost of freedom shot up, out of sight.  
L-plates flaunt dreams but clutching tight,  
young hearts brake, purse strings frayed,  
mile-long waitlists on winding roads,  
an odometer ticking under pressure—  
all for the key, the wheel, the right  
to steer life's uncertain weather.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It’s wild’: how the cost of learning to drive in the UK is accelerating Learning to drive – and the sense of freedom and independence that comes with it – is a milestone many look forward to. But for today’s learners, the journey to getting on the road is proving longer, more uncertain and more expensive than ever. What was once a fairly straightforward process, from lessons and the theory test to the practical exam,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
